Articles.Content: The title says all. All you have to do is to quote the previous post, even if it has like a thousand quotes nested.

Quote

 

Edited January 31, 2022 by kerbiloid

8 minutes ago, kerbiloid said:
Quote

11 minutes ago, Nazalassa said:

 

quote
Quote

2 minutes ago, kerbiloid said:
Quote

 

Expand

Ah, seems like we're having some problems there: when clicking "Quote" at the bottom of the post, it does NOT quote the quotes, which is exactly the opposite of what we want.

Also, it appears to be difficult to select the quote to click "quote selection". The problem is real.

So, as I might be unclear, the goal is to quote all the previous quotes, in a new quote.

If you want to help others, I suggest that you put some text before and after the quote, like:

Quote

January 31st, 2022

Quote

/* All the previous quotes */

I like bananas.

It's not mandatory, but it's an idea to make the quoting more... Quotable.

Let's start again with these clarifications (sorry @BlackMesaSurvivor, @kerbiloid and @Admiral Fluffy).

1 hour ago, Nazalassa said:

The title says all. All you have to do is to quote the previous post, even if it has like a thousand quotes nested.

Enjoy!

P.S: To make it short, just don't use the "Quote" button below the post, but instead quote a selection covering the whole post. If you quote my post, for example, just quote from "Let's start again" to "Enjoy!", and then (optionally) remove everything but the quot.

Edited January 31, 2022 by Nazalassa
I was unclear, unclear, unclear, unclear... *edits* No longer am I unclear now.
We can just ask the forum admin about the free space on the HDD and calculate how many posts do we need to make them upgrade the hardware.

Basically, it's doing what I do every day with the school's computers

Let's do that! It would be faster than installing gcc on the school's computers.
On 1/31/2022 at 11:38 AM, Venusian Explorer said:

I just tried to select the Quote and then clicked "Quote selection", and removed the line at the bottom. It worked.

8 minutes ago, Akagi said:
On 1/31/2022 at 7:38 PM, Venusian Explorer said:

 

I repeat, CLICKING "QUOTE" AT THE BOTTOM OF THE POST DOESN'T WORK. YOU HAVE TO SELECT THE QUOTE AND THEN PRESS "QUOTE SELECTION".

Sorry if the uppercase letters are a bit agressive, but it's the only way to quote a quote in a quote in a quote in [...] a post.

As I did, you can help others by putting text around the quote, so selectioning it is easier.

Used "quote" under post @SSTO Crasher, right? Well, I repeat for the billion-th time, THIS DOESN'T WORK, sorry. Report to the moderators if you're not happy, I can do nothing to fix it.

Proof that it's possible:

So, PLEASE take the time to select the whole quote. After some training it will be super-easy!

P.S: I'm not asking you to post screenshots BTW.
